user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2 is: Language extensions should not be used.
You should report only when the code uses any language compiler extensions that are explicitly stated as an extension in compiler documentations.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of digest_get_size:
```c
_MHD_static_inline unsigned int
digest_get_size (struct DigestAlgorithm *da)
{
  mhd_assert (! da->uninitialised);
  mhd_assert (da->algo_selected);
#ifdef MHD_MD5_SUPPORT
  if (MHD_DIGEST_BASE_ALGO_MD5 == da->algo)
    return MD5_DIGEST_SIZE;
#endif /* MHD_MD5_SUPPORT */
#ifdef MHD_SHA256_SUPPORT
  if (MHD_DIGEST_BASE_ALGO_SHA256 == da->algo)
    return SHA256_DIGEST_SIZE;
#endif /* MHD_SHA256_SUPPORT */
#ifdef MHD_SHA512_256_SUPPORT
  if (MHD_DIGEST_BASE_ALGO_SHA512_256 == da->algo)
    return SHA512_256_DIGEST_SIZE;
#endif /* MHD_SHA512_256_SUPPORT */
  mhd_assert (0); /* May not happen */
  return 0;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function digest_get_size:
#define _MHD_static_inline staticinline__attribute__((always_inline))
...
#define mhd_assert(ignore) ((void)0)
...
struct DigestAlgorithm
{
  /**
   * A context for the digest algorithm, already initialized to be
   * useful for @e init, @e update and @e digest.
   */
  union DigestCtx ctx;

  /**
   * The hash calculation algorithm.
   */
  enum MHD_DigestBaseAlgo algo;

  /**
   * Buffer for hex-print of the final digest.
   */
#ifdef _DEBUG
  bool uninitialised; /**< The structure has been not set-up */
  bool algo_selected; /**< The algorithm has been selected */
  bool ready_for_hashing; /**< The structure is ready to hash data */
  bool hashing; /**< Some data has been hashed, but the digest has not finalised yet */
#endif /* _DEBUG */
}
...
#define MHD_MD5_SUPPORT 1
...
#define MHD_SHA256_SUPPORT 1
...
#define MHD_SHA512_256_SUPPORT 1
...
#define MD5_DIGEST_SIZE (MD5_DIGEST_SIZE_WORDS*MD5_BYTES_IN_WORD)
...
#define SHA256_DIGEST_SIZE (SHA256_DIGEST_SIZE_WORDS*SHA256_BYTES_IN_WORD)
...
#define SHA512_256_DIGEST_SIZE (SHA512_256_DIGEST_SIZE_WORDS*SHA512_256_BYTES_IN_WORD)
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: Other parts of the code use standard C constructs and do not contain compiler-specific language extensions that require investigation under MISRA C: preprocessor conditionals (#ifdef/#endif), standard macros for sizes, enum and union types, the mhd_assert macro defined as ((void)0), use of bool inside a debug-only #ifdef, and ordinary control-flow and return statements. No other compiler-specific builtins or extensions such as asm statements, typeof, __builtin_..., #pragma with nonstandard semantics, __packed__, or other __attribute__ usages were found in the provided snippets, so they do not need investigation for Rule 1.2.
